website_summaries.verdict: Extremely clear lens with a low cost. Good performance in low light before sunset and after dawn.
pros: Dusk & Dawn Brightness coating for best results in low-light conditions
Works well on a variety of guns and for different types of hunting
Easy to make adjustments in the field
cons: Scope may fog up easily during humid conditions
Doesn't offer the quality of some pricier scopes

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this turned out to be way better than I expected. I put this on my Marlin 30-30 just in time for deer season. Sighted in at 100 yards with 4 rounds. My friends and I put another's 100 rounds though it at the range that day and it held it's zero perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: That Ain't Working

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic scope for the price! I use a Leupold VX-1 on my hunting rifle, and bought this Bushnell for my 22lr and I almost like it better than the Leupold. Now, I am not going to tell you it is higher quality or has better glass than the Leupold, but it does give me good clarity with a wider field of view, which I love. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it. Did a lot of research for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for $60 and it was worth it, couldn’t zero with 1/2 moa and needed a 1/4 moa. Compared it to a few other hunting buddies scopes and it was clear past dusk and early dawn. Highly recommend it. Did a lot of research for a good scope and realized you can only shoot deer 30 min before sun up and after sun down, this goes beyond that and holds zero on my 6mm. Why spend more for a scope than a rifle if not shooting past 300 yards. Thought the reticle would be hard to see in twilight but it isn’t, it is clear where center crosshairs are.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Everything you want in a scope
customer_reviews.text: Using on a Savage Axis .308. Holds zero. Clear sight picture. Good in low light. Elevation/Windage adjustments with audible and positive "clicks". Have only used at max of 100 yds, but it is excellent at that distance .
customer_reviews.author: Summer Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for twice the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how you beat this scope for TWICE the money!! I have Vortex scopes that I love and this little scope hangs right with them! They are clear and are very very good at light transmission in low light situations. They are every bit as good as my Nikon Buckmaster and my Vortex crossfire and easily tie a Leupold VX-2!!! Bushnell is back!!!
customer_reviews.author: 04Blackram

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great scope for the price. I put it on my old Savage .22 Hornet and I'm getting better groups than I did with my old scope. The crosshairs are a little on the thick side for precision shooting, but on the other hand are easy for my old eyes to see.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Guess

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for buck. I got it on a Smith&Wesson m&p 15. I read somebody say it was to big for an AR...I guess beaty is in the eye of the beholder, because to me... it's perfect. Very clear vision
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to zero
customer_reviews.text: Zeroing the scope was a breeze, I zeroed it at 25 yards then at 100 yards very minor adjustments is bright and clear and it looks good to..I put 300 rounds so far it held zero and no issues whatsoever . Will see in my next trip to the range if it held zero permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Alan rios

customer_reviews.title: I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a lot of luck with Bushnell. I read all the reviews and decided to take a gamble on it. Paid extra for the 2 day shipping. Took it 3 days. Mounted it to my Ruger American Ranch and went to the range. Windage adjusted just fine but the elevation would not adjust. I maxed out the elevation and was still shooting 8in low. Took it to a gun shop for a second opinion and gun shop could not fix it. I got a lemon. Amazon was good about returning it and refunding my money. Spent the money and got a Vortex.
customer_reviews.author: Entmeier2055

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for it's price. Worked fine for me!
customer_reviews.text: Results speak for themselves... I wasn't happy with the scope that came on my Traditions muzzleloader so I purchased this scope as a alternative. Like most of us, I'm not made of money. This scope preformed well for it's price and was easy to zero in. I shot this 12 point at dusk and got a perfect heart shot at around 40 yards. Not bad for it's price. I do recommend this. Seems to hold up to the recoil from my .50 cal with 100gr so I'd imagine it would be good for most large calibers or shotguns.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: 1 Star for Bushnell QC
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much liked everything about this scope. Got it when it was marked down to $56 which was an extreme value. Glass clarity and brightness equal to scopes 2-3x the price, let alone anything the in the sub-$75 price range. Zero'd easily and held zero the 2 times I shot it. BUT......sometime between the last time I shot it about a week ago and today the reticle turned inside the scope. It's now canted 5-10 degrees to the left. 1 star for QC for Bushnell. Returned to Amazon. I replaced it with the AO version of the same scope. So far it looks good. Let's see how it holds up. (Incidentally, shooting it on a 22lr)
customer_reviews.author: mw61

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I put the scope on my Ruger PC carbine and it works very good. And I was able to site the scope in with under 10 rounds. I got a dialed in a 25 yards. And I'm able to shoot it out to 300 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Riley R

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are that this is a great scope. Put it on around dusk and was ...
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are that this is a great scope. Put it on around dusk and was still able to see clearly through it, lots of visibility in low light. For a sub $100 scope it’s hard to beat. Seems well constructed and a great addition to many rifles. Currently sitting on my .223/556 AR15. Will update to see zero holding once I get a chance to shoot it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put on a resto project. Just an old Remington 760 in 30.06. I didn't want anything fancy. For the money, this is a good scope. Held zero after about 80 rounds. Fairly clear glass. Eye box is acceptable. Magnification ring is a little stiff, but nothing to worry about. Overall, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff B

customer_reviews.title: Unleveled crosshair after a few shots
customer_reviews.text: After a few shots crosshair got unleveled. Right side is lower than left side.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: First Scope I've ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome scope. I mounted it on my Henry 45-70 Government and dialed it in from 25 yards (not keeping it there, dont worry) and my groups were consistent and the scope had no issues. I'll rewrite the review if I have any problems with it when I sight in from a 100 yards, but I dont expect any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bogie689

customer_reviews.title: Great for an old .22LR
customer_reviews.text: For less than $100, I didn't expect a whole lot. But I planned to mount this on a Marlin Model 60 for some plinking, and was quite pleased with the glass quality and eye relief. The scope seems sturdy, and the picture is very clear. Unless issues develop with it somehow, this was incredible bang for my buck for an old .22LR. I'm quite happy. Installed in some Modkin dovetail mounts, it's rock steady and holds zero with a crisp picture and large eye relief. A+ from me.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin W.

customer_reviews.title: mossberg 835
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only mounted scope and looked through it at all magnification levels. Very clear, bright and good eye relief on mossberg 835. I will use this for deer slug and possibly turkey season here in SW Ohio. Once I fire shotgun with slugs for zero I will change review good or bad. Seems to be good value for $$. I needed longer scope to get eye relief set correctly. Our barn is 125 yards behind house and I can clearly see lettering on barn signs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hunting Scope
customer_reviews.text: Very very clear. For the price you cannot beat this scope. Mounted on Winchester 670
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scope for my new Henrey single shot 243 rifle. Optics are very sharp and indeed work well in low light. Took a bit to get it zeroed in but once I did it held its accuracy. Looks really good on my rifle and compliments it's looks. A unbelievable value for the price, photo is shooting group at 100 yards on a simi windy day.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pracht

customer_reviews.title: solid cheapo
customer_reviews.text: korean>china any day. Bushnell is doing it right. took a beating from my high velocity shotgun rounds and gained 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scope for 100 yard shots.
customer_reviews.text: Placed it on my Traditions Black powder rifle. 5 shots and it was zeroed in at 25 yards. I moved out to 50 yards and it was still on. Skipped 75 and went for 100 yards and it was dead on at 1 DOA down. I fired 8 more rounds with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H@VABEACH

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment turrets labled or work backwards
customer_reviews.text: After much frustration at the range realized that the Left/Right adjustment turret raises and lowers the sights and the Up/Down turret turns the sights Left and Right. Sadly these defects are not noted till a day at the range. Pay more and get an effective scope.
customer_reviews.author: CWO4 GUNNER

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best value out there!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on top of my CZ 457 American .22 Mag rifle, and it's perfect! After a simple sighting-in, my final 5-shot group @ 50 yds was 0.45" The multi X reticle (fine cross-hairs inside thicker cross-hairs) provides an exact picture to squeeze at. Couldn't be more pleased. I have scopes costing three and four times the price of this one, and I'd put this up against any of them.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Bushnell!
customer_reviews.text: Of course another amazing product from Bushnell! This is my 3rd or 4th scope over the years and it's perfect. I've had Scopes from them from $1,000 to a few hundred dollars great product. I have this on a bull barrel savage 17 hmr and it's a tack driver "literally" can't go wrong with Bushnell! Get this scope u won't regret it. I will always go with Bushnell every time they are high quality and in the "working man's price range" great scope!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Best deal under $100
customer_reviews.text: I returned a UTG bug buster and bought this instead. It doesn’t have all of the colored lights and bells and whistles but it has far superior clarity, accuracy and zero than the buster. It does what it’s supposed to better than other scopes in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Antique Future

customer_reviews.title: nice scope
customer_reviews.text: the front site on my henry .22 magnum is just plain black. In low light situations, it becomes invisible. First I thought about replacing the front site. then I got to thinking about scopes and did a little, ( not too much) research before choosing this one. It is nice and bright in low light, zeroed at 100 yards real quick.
customer_reviews.author: garlue

customer_reviews.title: The Zeiss is no better in quality than the Bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value for a top quality scope! I have scopes than cost 10X this as in ZEISS. The Zeiss is no better in quality than the Bushnell . VERY IMPRESSED and bought another one for my 9422 Magnum. I’m sure the Zeiss has better optics but to the trained eye (MINE) I just don’t see it. My ZEISS is on a 300 Weatherby Magnum and a 240 Weatherby Magum
customer_reviews.author: D.G. Weems

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Who says you need $300-$1,000 scope to get the job done? Put this bad boy on a Marlin 336 and couldn't be happier with results. Clear glass, great low light and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: truthbetold

customer_reviews.title: AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: I did not know what to expect as I had read a couple of complaints that were about this scope although most posts were favorable. Let me go down on record as putting my faith in the Bushnell brand name. The scope, when adjusted to your particular eye relief, has a wonderful view of everything in your sights. I don't believe that it can be beat for the modest investment that you have to make. I certainly would recommend this to any hunter or target shooter.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: moa adj not working properly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for inexpensive brush rifle. Understand its not a highend scope. took to range and had it on very quickly. Attempted to move 1 inch up and 1/2 inch over and poi didnt move. did it again and it moved like crazy. re-adjusted 4x before urge to throw scope at target overwhelmed me... moa adjustment way out of whack. going to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. good price.
customer_reviews.text: Well I was hesitant on buying a cheap (er) scope. But I'm honestly impressed with it. The glass is super clear even zoomed all the way in. Seems durable. Got it zerod in at 200 yards and I've loc tightened all the threads on the mount so we'll see how long she holds zero. Honestly I've got no complaints as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Ol son

customer_reviews.title: Wony hold zero
customer_reviews.text: After spending over 200 on ammo i realized the scope will not hold zero . im shooting a 243
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Gunsalus

customer_reviews.title: Clear quality
customer_reviews.text: Very clear optics. I have this attached on my 5.56 AR with a high mount and love it. I like the multi x crosshairs over the circle x version.
customer_reviews.author: Evan G

customer_reviews.title: Above and Beyond
customer_reviews.text: This rifle scope went above and beyond my expectations. The accuracy that I was able to achieve was truly remarkable. I would definitely buy another one of these if I had another rifle to mount it on. A rather inexpensive scope that works as good as the pricey ones.
customer_reviews.author: Tyzuki

customer_reviews.title: Decent scope - nice price
customer_reviews.text: The scope has decent optics and light gathering. It isn't as good as my more expensive scopes, but has good clarity and very affordable. I purchased this one and at UTG Bugbuster at the same time. While the Bugbuster is more compact and durable enough for my springer air rifle, the Bushnell has noticeably better clarity and quality. It's a good scope for the budget minded and I am going to pick up a second one before fall.
customer_reviews.author: Rigel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm gonna have to buy 2 more!! I absolutely love it, looking through the lense is crystal clear. Quality is awesome. I can always count on Bushnell! Remember no matter what product there's bound to be a bad egg. If you find 1 return it you won't be disappointed. Right now this scope is sitting on my 300 black out and I'm in love.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very decent scope
customer_reviews.text: Most scopes go for hundreds of dollars if your looking for a decent one with decent eye relief and everything, if you try to take a short cut and buy cheap you usually get what you pay for, a piece of crap. But not this Bushnell. It’s well worth it!! It’s on my ruger American and it’s done very well both getting sighted in, the eye relief. And keeping zero’d in.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Bungo

customer_reviews.title: I love these Scopes
customer_reviews.text: I love these Scopes. Image clarity is really good for the price. I mounted 2 of these on 2 of my AR's. The zoom and focus is really nice! Seem well built and are of high quality (compared to what I paid for them). With the lifetime warranty, what could go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Quality Scope
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed by this scope so far. Sighted in easily on my 30-30, and holds the zero well. Excellent in low light conditions. I can see well beyond when my own eyes can no longer see my target. Great value for the money. I will likely use this scope on other hunting rifles as well. I have and will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ben thurston

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have many scopes, Vortex Razor, PST II, Strike Eagles on down. Bought this one for a new Winchester 30-30, for under 250 yards, all that is needed. Clarity/sharpness/brightness very acceptable for the price, better than the Vortex Crossfire II I have on a scout rifle. BUT....holy moly, Bushnell, could you tone down the MADE IN CHINA in big etched white letters? Order some Birchwood Casey touch up with this to cover it. Good buy for entry level glass.
customer_reviews.author: Norseman

customer_reviews.title: It has held up so far
customer_reviews.text: I put this one on a .270. To be honest, I haven’t put more than 50 rounds through it since mounting the optic, but it has held zero to this point with no issues. It looks and feels a little cheaper than some of the other bushnell products I have purchased (probably because it is), hence only four stars. Overall, I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great scope. Great reviews lead me to buy this for a 10/22 build. I must have got luck as I paid less than $60 for this. At time of this review is over $80. So far all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Traci X.

customer_reviews.title: Can handle the recoil of 300 blk
customer_reviews.text: For 70$, you cant beat this scope. however when compared to more expensive scopes you can definitely tell the glass this scope uses is not the best. Considering the price point, this is a great hunting scope for inside 200 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: but the optics are not bad at all and the quality is definitely worth twice ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on an Uberti Silver Boy .22 LR lever-actionn rifle. It's a little big for the rifle, visually, but the optics are not bad at all and the quality is definitely worth twice the cost of a Simmons or Tasco. Eye relief is perfect for my rifle and all adjustments have a quality feel to them. I used medium profile rings with the factory scope base that came with the rifle and height was perfect for clearing the hammer and rear sight.
customer_reviews.author: Travis T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Scope for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Had this on my 3006 for a few years. Handled the recoil perfectly. The glass is nice and visible, at least at 3x. I rarely find myself at 9x unless target shooting, even then its better then I could expect, expensively that this is on sale for less than $70. Which it had mil dots but for larger calibers thats fine. The low light is great, but its probably the same as other scopes that are 3-9x. Bought another for my 243 cause, cheap, good, and reliable
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good light gathering scope
customer_reviews.text: Good light gathering scope easy to sight gun in and very durable have one on 45/70 and a 450 for years now they still accurate last one purchased was installed on semi auto 10 gauge for fox hunting works great
customer_reviews.author: Jared West

customer_reviews.title: Would buy another
customer_reviews.text: So far seems like a great purchase. Mounted on a Savage MkII BTV. 3/4" groups at 50 yards in 2-7mph variable wind using Aquila SuperExtra.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and it was a hit. The graphics were great for the amount of money spent. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing scope
customer_reviews.text: Amazing scope for the money. By far the best scope on ots segment. Clear and accurate. For its price it is the best scope on the market right now.
customer_reviews.author: Juanpi

customer_reviews.title: Good light gathering scope
customer_reviews.text: Good quality scopes at a reasonable price. This is my second one. I will probably replace another brand on my third rifle with one of these also. Works great in early morning and late evening
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Sturgis

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scope, especially for the price! I put it on a rugar 1022 and its perfect. I bought another one for another 22 I have. For the price of this , it is great quality. Easy to adjust
customer_reviews.author: 3ptman

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are Quality scopes that doesn't break the budget,bought one at a large retail store, liked it so well looked it up on Amazon and bought two more at a much cheaper price
customer_reviews.author: G.B.Hickman

customer_reviews.title: 17hmr
customer_reviews.text: Install on 93r17 savage. Great scope for the cash. Compared to Nikon at 2x price hard to see the difference. No point of impact change throughout magnification range. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jjh in WI

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for my Henry 357 magnum
customer_reviews.text: Mounting on a HP Rifle. Waiting on rings but the scope has a clear sight and seems very well built. Reasonable price and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value for small caliber
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for price, not as good eye relief as my more expensive scopes, but for a .22 or .17 very good choice. Bright scope, replacing a BSA .17 scope.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability
customer_reviews.text: Pros: clear, laser bore sighted only. Cons: non yet. Will up date after zeroing on cva accura v2
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product... highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough about this scope! Great clarity early in morning and at dusk... compared with 2 other scopes that were each 2 - 3 times the price and the Bushnell Banner STILL had better clarity... GREAT JOB AT AN AWESOME PRICE POINT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a Ruger 10/22
customer_reviews.text: Great riflescope for my Ruger 10/22. If you need a good set of rings that will fit on the stock picatinny rail, check these out:
customer_reviews.author: Blackntan777

customer_reviews.title: Good scope
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Marlin 336 30/30 added the game reaper mount and could not be more satisfied with this scope, glass is clear and fits my eye perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Byron j

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and well made for the money I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and well made for the money I have it installed on a 22 but will try it on 223 and will write an additional review.
customer_reviews.author: yazman

customer_reviews.title: Great scope, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great scope, especially for the price! I replaced an older .22 scope with this and it has a much better eye reticle. Much easier to find your target!
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive scope for my daughters .22 mag. Crosshairs held true and for the price it couldn’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: A great alternative for those who want to drop a deer without dropping a grand on a scope
customer_reviews.author: Parshman

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell "B" on this one is for BEST.
customer_reviews.text: It may not be the highest price one in the pin. But this purchase was a great choice. Clear, crisp, and incredible quality. Good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ill eddy

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what ........
customer_reviews.text: A clear super easy focus !!! mounted on Crosman CVH22RDNS-WX .22-Caliber Valiant Wood
customer_reviews.author: D. A

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Sets my Ruger 556 up just right!
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Lousy customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two scopes. One of the scopes arrived with a damaged cover. I reached out to Bushnell for a replacement several times. Their computer assigned numbers but no one ever responded. I am so disappointed in customer service that I will never buy or recommend Bushnell products again.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Disney

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on a Ruger 22 American Rifle. I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Indigo Flats

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: Scope was shipped fast. Great scope for the money,really clear, sighted in rife great crystal clear lenses, able to clear for eye easily.would buy again if needed. Gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Havnt had time a range yet
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be a nice scope quality wise bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to mount and zero
customer_reviews.text: works well and seems to hold zero well. Eye relief seems adequate and image is bright.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item as described , great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Item as described , great quality. Pleasantly surprised on the quality and accuracy with the price point. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Decent scope with clear view and doesn't break the bank. I mounted on a Savage 17HMR.
customer_reviews.author: Scott O.

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell Banner is a Hit
customer_reviews.text: Have always been a fan of Bushnell and this scope is exactly what I wanted. It does everything it is advertise to do. Will continue to be a Bushnell customer as long as they continue to produce scopes of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: oneobserver

customer_reviews.title: Worth it well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made and gives me great groupings with my pellet rifle
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and price
customer_reviews.text: Ought one for my 30 30 a few weeks back and absolutely loved it clear and accurate bought a second one a week later. Definitely the best bang for your “buck” 🦌 lol
customer_reviews.author: John whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: Great scope it has excellent low light optics. Very clear and seems to be holding up mounted on my .444 Marlin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good scope
customer_reviews.text: Great scope for the money, put it on a mosin and camo painted it with the gun, works well out to 150 yards, that's as far as I've shot it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great scope. Looks good, easy adjust, and holds its zero.
customer_reviews.author: Spud

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scope!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scope to put on my high powered pellet gun. Best scope you can buy for little under $100. I’ve owned a lot of different scopes for my AR’s and deer rifles. So I kinda know quality when I see it. For the money this scope is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Gandee

customer_reviews.title: So-So for the money
customer_reviews.text: A little dust particle is visible at the end of the view range, a bit annoying. Otherwise good.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good scope
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a .22 that I bought for a gift. Easy to mount, view doesn't float, and Bushnell builds them right!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Fast Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, Fast Shipping! Super Clear Scope at 300 Yards, at Dusk or Dawn and anywhere in between!!!
customer_reviews.author: cgdrider

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Henry rifles (or for most rifles) Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted two of them, one on my Henry .22 LR and my Henry .22 Magnum. Perfect. Rebate process is a pain. Don't throw out the box before doing the online rebate. You need the UPC from the box. Oops, too late for me.
customer_reviews.author: Roger B

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for sons birthday to go with his new gun. Works perfect, he's been target practicing all afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Actually killed a buck the first night I put this on!
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's a fine product...
customer_reviews.text: But I went the route of a scope with integrated laser.
customer_reviews.author: LittleFaster

customer_reviews.title: Good, clear scope
customer_reviews.text: Put it on a new marlin xt22m. Good, clear scope. Bushnell quality is still there and I couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: Now I can see
customer_reviews.text: I always depend on Bushnell. Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Great Low-Light Scope
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a neighborhood pond that has a nutria rat problem. Bought a big nitro piston .22 pellet gun but the scope that came with it was lacking. Huge difference with this scope, very very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Cajun

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scope for the money. Low light performance is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Sean T.

customer_reviews.title: No mount included
customer_reviews.text: Was very upset to find it does not come with mounting hardware
customer_reviews.author: Devin L.

customer_reviews.title: It was the right price and works well
customer_reviews.text: I also have an swfa 12x42. I like them equally for what they are. The 12x42 is on my long range AR and the bushnell is on my 10/22. Hopefully I can harvest some cottontails with the bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came with adjustments super loose. Took a hour of playing with it to get it on paper.
customer_reviews.author: matthew canada

customer_reviews.title: Scope
customer_reviews.text: Had a gun smith mount this to my deer rifle. Too bad it was made in China
customer_reviews.author: gabor s korthy

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope no issues
customer_reviews.text: Loved metrics but too long for my rifle so I had to send back
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: I was very well pleased with this scope
customer_reviews.text: Received it in very timely manner. I was very well pleased with this scope. Well made , far better than expected considering the price. It’s not a $300 scope but I have had $300 scopes that were nowhere near as good. Very clear at all magnifications. Don’t know about long term, time will tell, but up to this point I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Great scope! Had great low light conditions and perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: Great scope! Had great low light conditions and perfect eye relief. I have 3 of them now. Love it on my AR 10 and on my Remington 700 bdl.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on 30-06 works well gathers light well in the evening and early morning hrs
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Barden

product_meta.title: Bushnell Banner Dusk & Dawn Multi-X Reticle Riflescope with 3.3-Inch Eye Relief, 3-9X 40mm
product_meta.description: Ask any trophy hunter. They'll tell you more tags are filled in the low-light hours than any other time. Enter the Bushnell Banner 3-9x 40 Multi-X riflescope, a scope designed to excel in early-morning and late-evening light. Featuring Dusk & Dawn Brightness (DDB) multi-coated lenses for clarity and brightness in low light, you'll add precious minutes to every hunting day with the Banner Dusk & Dawn series. With one-piece tube design, the Banner Dusk & Dawn line includes a full assortment of specialty scopes for big-game, varmint, .22 rimfire, slug, black powder and turkey hunting.
feature_bullets: Quality optics with stunning HD clarity
100 percentage quality materials used and tested extensively
Beautiful design and durability built to last
Low light rifle scope with 3 to 9x magnification and 40 millimeter objective lens
Dusk & Dawn Brightness (DDB) multicoated lenses for clarity and brightness
Multi X reticle; 1/4 MOA fingertip windage and elevation adjustments
100 percent waterproof/fog proof construction; 3.3 inches of eye relief
Fast focus eyepiece; Measures 12 inches long
